remarks: For a piecewise smooth function, the left and the right limits exist at any point.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
fourierdlem106.f $e |- ( ph -> F : RR --> RR ) $.
fourierdlem106.t $e |- T = ( 2 x. _pi ) $.
fourierdlem106.per $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( F ` ( x + T ) ) = ( F ` x ) ) $.
fourierdlem106.g $e |- G = ( ( RR _D F ) |` ( -u _pi (,) _pi ) ) $.
fourierdlem106.dmdv $e |- ( ph -> ( ( -u _pi (,) _pi ) \ dom G ) e. Fin ) $.
fourierdlem106.dvcn $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( dom G -cn-> CC ) ) $.
fourierdlem106.rlim $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( ( -u _pi [,) _pi ) \ dom G ) ) -> ( ( G |` ( x (,) +oo ) ) limCC x ) =/= (/) ) $.
fourierdlem106.llim $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( ( -u _pi (,] _pi ) \ dom G ) ) -> ( ( G |` ( -oo (,) x ) ) limCC x ) =/= (/) ) $.
fourierdlem106.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem106 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ( F |` ( -oo (,) X ) ) limCC X ) =/= (/) /\ ( ( F |` ( X (,) +oo ) ) limCC X ) =/= (/) ) ) $.
$d F x $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d T x $.
$d X x $.
$d ph x $.
